title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Just saw Bullet Train, a very very entertaining movie and loved the experience. The chemistry between Brian and Aaron is just pleasure to watch on screen. Would definitely recommend.
I read mixed reviews, is it really worth watching in theatres. Was planning to watch.
Saw the sandman... its pretty decent, especially if you go in completely blind.

Well, it was boatloads of fun for me, I repeat in no way it is a movie which is great in any aspect. But I like Brad Pitt, and the charisma he shows on screen is just magnetic.

I am a sucker for old school legit movie stars and I like at least decent action movies, this movie has both and plus it made me laugh multiple times so no complaints from me.
Watched Jaadugar. Disappointed. Had high hopes after Panchayat from Jitu bhai, but it's pathetic.

Saw Darlings on Netflix.
Pretty good dark comedy if you watch it without any bias and an open mind. 

Also, watching Only Murders in the building S2 on hotstar. Damn funny!
